info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 3:28PM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 20 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze for the southern Oregon Cascades from Lake of the Woods northward, Winter Rim, and Warner Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. Valley locations will receive a wintry mix with as much as 3 inches of new snow. * WHERE...North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County and Modoc County. This includes Diamond Lake Junction, Crater Lake, Lake Of The Woods, and the higher terrain of Lake and eastern Modoc counties. This also includes highways 62, 138, 230, 58, and 140 in the Cascades, and Cedar Pass on highway 299. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Sunday. The heaviest snow will occur through 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
